replies.body: Is that possible ? xD Even in this adc meta , Rengar can double kill them with {{item:3147}} only
Not if Xayah ults before the jump she won't. Focused fire from an ADC plus a support's CC usually spells death.
I mean, that Rengar seems very fed while the Xayah and Rakan must've been AFK the whole game.

As somebody else said, Xayah can pretty much negate his burst and then turn the situation on it's head simply by ulting. Rengar has to ult engage, so he goes for the leap, Xay waits for the engage then ults to negate one shot damage. Even if Rengar saves his kit so that it's not used on thin air, once Xay touches back down she can pull the feathers back for a stun then dispatch him easily as he's squishy. This is even more so with a Rakan for additional CC. The only plausible outplay would be to make sure Xay ult is on CD, or leap then sideways into a bush to dodge her feather pull and then to leap for the burst.
You have to  time it really well to counter rengar's burst. It's not like Syndra, Vi, Zed where Rengars burst is delayed and highly visible to when its starting.

Rengar's leap from max range takes less than half a second. With average human reaction time being around .2 seconds average between audio and visual queues, that leaves you with AT MOST .3 seconds to hit R. Playing in NA on the west coast, I get 70 ping because of where the servers are. Put that together, that's roughly .2 seconds AT MOST to try to disengage it if he is jumping from the farthest possible point.

As this is a game of milliseconds I'd say you got plenty of time to do something. If your statement was true then I wouldn't have to fear any peel supports, because you know they don't have time to react anyway.
but rengar clearly got caught out in this replay
You will see his mark on you, so as long as this is not your first game, you should be able to press R quick enough as soon as he jumps.
Assuming you have the latency to do it. Rengar's leap time is pretty quick, and it is not enough to just ult when you get the exclamation point over your head.

I agree with Kargish; it's not as hard as you would think. There's a bit of an audio cue when Rengar leaps. If you ult as soon as you hear him, you aren't going to take damage from the critical strike.
